title.narrative: The Netherlands Mine Action and Cluster Munitions Programme 2020-2024 - Laos

description.narrative: Under the Mine Action and Cluster Munitions Programme, HI will contribute to enhance human security among communities of Houaphan and Phongsaly provinces in Lao PDR impacted by Explosive Ordnance, and improve their resilience in the face of EO contamination. To that end, the project will adhere to a Comprehensive Approach to Mine Action, integrating Land Release, Risk Education, Community Liaison, Livelihoods, Victim Assistance and support to national mine action authorities.

title.narrative: Output 1.4 - Communities living in EO contaminated areas improve knowlege, attitudes and practices about EO related risks
1.4.4. # of RE beneficiaries who demonstrate knowledge retention

comment.narrative: As communicated with the donor, HI experienced in 2021 delays in the signature of the MoU and the accreditation for Mine Action intervention with Lao PDR authorities, that are mandatory to conduct activities. This situation, quite usual in Lao PDR, laster longer than usual in 2021 due to the COVID-19 lockdown which was imposed in Vientiane (from April 2021 onwards) - which made the MoU and accreditation signature particularly long to process. This explains that no target were achieved during the reporting period. The MoU was ultimately signed on July 29th, and the accreditation obtained on August 12th, while COVID-19 lockdown and travel restrictions in Houaphan province were lifted, which now allows HI to implement normally.
Target for the period from 01/09/2020 to 31/08/2024

title.narrative: Output 2.4 - Survivors, and other most vulnerable beneficiaries, are referred to relevant medical, MHPSS, or rehabilitation services and followed up
2.4.1. # of VA benefiaries ("200 vulnerable beneficiaries are prioritized and referred to available services")

comment.narrative: 30 UXO suvivors/people with disabilities were selected from 18 new villages. They will be provided livelihood training package of cows, goat and pig farming in May 2022, with grant support.

Due to COVID-19 lockdown, the project VA team could not conduct the UXO survivors screening in the target villages in this quarter and it will be implementing in next Q4
First referral and case management to be started and reported in the next reporting period
Screening and identification is still on process. During next period, the priorisation and support will be provided to newly identified persons with disabilities

title.narrative: Output 1.3 - Risk of EO related death and injury are reduced safely and the feeling of safety is increased through land release activities
1.3.1. # items destroyed disaggregated by type (AP, AT, IED, UXO, AXO, etc).

comment.narrative: Target for the period from 01/09/2020 to 31/08/2024

2020: Through area clearance: 294 cluster munitions and 99 UXO / Through technical survey: 79 cluster munitions / Remote operating vehicle: 7 bombs, 71 cluster munitions, 1 anti-personal mine, 270 UXO // 2021: Remote operating vehicle: 2 anti-personal mine, 1 cluster munition, 15 UXO

The MoU was ultimately signed on July 29th, and the accreditation obtained on August 12th, while COVID-19 lockdown and travel restrictions in Houaphan province were lifted, which now allows HI to implement normally.
including 651 cluster munitions
including 756 cluster munitions

title.narrative: Output 2.1 - Tailored community safety committees approached at village level provide durable solutions/dynamics to mitigate the risks of EO accidents ensuring flexible response and conflict sensitivity

comment.narrative: 99 spot tasks conducted - 2 not found on site. 98% success of spot tasks.

As communicated with the donor, HI experienced in 2021 delays in the signature of the MoU and the accreditation for Mine Action intervention with Lao PDR authorities, that are mandatory to conduct activities. This situation, quite usual in Lao PDR, laster longer than usual in 2021 due to the COVID-19 lockdown which was imposed in Vientiane (from April 2021 onwards) - which made the MoU and accreditation signature particularly long to process. This explains that no target were achieved during the reporting period. The MoU was ultimately signed on July 29th, and the accreditation obtained on August 12th, while COVID-19 lockdown and travel restrictions in Houaphan province were lifted, which now allows HI to implement normally.
HI received 50 spot tasks requests and completed 48 tasks. The 2 remaining will be completed in April 2022.

HI received 71 spot task requests during the reporting period - 65 has been destroyed, 6 are pending in Hiem district thus reporting will be done at QR5 stage. This is due to leave period of EOD4 staff as well as the COVID19 outbreak in Hiem during the reporting period.
HI received 73 spot task request during the reporting period - 70 leading to a conducted EOD spot task.
